results.title: Transportation: a ship comes home
results.creator_credit: Manfred Kirchheimer and Hudson Valley Film Productions
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the complexity of modern ocean transportation as we observe the exacting manoeuvres, expert timing, and the alertness to every shift of wind and current that are necessary to bring the majestic liner ‘The United States’ into port at New York harbour.

results.title: Transportation
results.creator_credit: National Geographic Society, Jim Larison and Elaine Larison
results.brief_description: This film illustrates some of the ways in which transportation affects - even shapes - our lives. Explores many modes of transportation, from private such as bicycles or cars, to public mass transit, such as buses and trains. Also looks at aeroplane, railroad and ship transport. Suitable for Middle-Upper Primary level students. Teacher’s guide included.

results.title: Transport in plants and animals: capture of nutrients in plants and animals
results.creator_credit: Glen Foster, Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education and Shane Mulcahy
results.brief_description: 1. “Transport in plants and animals”. Explains how plants and animals transport their nutritional requirements internally. Similarities and differences between the transport methods are discussed. 2. “Capture of nutrients in plants and animals”. Every living organism needs a method of taking nutrients and of spelling waste products. This program examines which nutrients are esential to plants and animals and compares the system used to achieve this exchange of substances.

results.title: Transmission of rotary motion

results.brief_description: Gives a simple explanation of the transmission of rotary motion. Shows and disc usses examples of simple shafts, flexible shafting, gear drive, chain drive, and belt drive.

results.title: Transmission of electricity
results.brief_description: How electricity is transmitted from the power station to the consumer. The principles of the transformer are developed from simple experiments; shows a modern transformer station and explains the principle of step-up and step-down transformers; shows the operation of a circuit breaker; shows the grid system and the network of sub-stations which supply power for factories and homes.

results.title: Transition generation: a third world problem
results.creator_credit: Alex Von Wetter and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Shows the problems of the first generation of literate young people in Afghanistan, which began a modernisation program in the ‘50’s. Discusses the immensity of the social, emotional and cultural flexibility required of these young people.
